name: Oakthwaite House

reviews.text: This delightful B&B has more in common with a boutique hotel than a guesthouse given its clean white decor and furnishings, luxury toileteries and quality breakfasts. The unusual and rewarding breakfast selection includes delicious home made granola, bacon or soft cheese bagels, crepes with fresh fruit cocktail and maple syrup in addition to a fine traditional english breakfast. David and Karen, the hosts, are very welcoming and possess an encyclopedic knowledge on the local fells and activities. It is unlikely one can find a better B&B at affordable prices than Oakthwaite House.
reviews.title: Best B&B in The Lakes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from a night away in Keswick. Found Oakthwaite via Tripadvisor and I have to say the reviews were spot on.
reviews.title: Perfect B&B

likes.liked: — The attention to detail. Smart, clean room, friendly host
likes.disliked: — That we could only stay the one night!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a little gem of a B&B.
reviews.title: Fantastic B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in the kingsize ensuite room. The room was clean and tidy and smart. The ensuite more than adequate.
reviews.title: Already booked another visit!

likes.liked: — service, facilities, value for money and the breakfasts!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cooked breakfast in the morning would fuel you well for a hard day's walking, hiking, climbing or sight seeing
reviews.title: Bag of goodies

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have just returned from two wonderful days stay in Keswick. The whole experience was excellent from the spotless accommodation, lovely food (the granola is too die for), to the very attentive but not overpowering hosts David and Karen.
reviews.title: perfect experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As this was our first time in Keswick we needed guidance on places to eat, ideal walks etc and David provided all of this information even providing maps,timetables which of course proved invaluable.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am sure you will have a very difficult time too find a better guest house from which to explore this delightful area.
reviews.title: What a treat!
Fantastic Bed and Breakfast
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed here when we were in the Lakes last weekend. We were made to feel very welcome from the start. David helped us with our bags to our room which was very comfortable, airy and clean. We loved the many little touches which made our stay special. It was obvious that Karen and David had put a lot of thought and effort into the place and into making their guests' stay comfortable and memorable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed at many B&Bs, Oakthwaite House really stands out from the others we’ve stayed at. Breakfasts were excellent and with lots of choice, the place felt really homely and yet quite chic. Karen and David are very welcoming and friendly hosts, easy to talk to. All in all our weekend stay was very special. We shall definitely be returning.
reviews.title: fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Both my wife and I stayed at the Oakthwaite House 31 Mar - 4 Apr 08. Oakthwaite House situated in the wonderfull town of Keswick has something unique to offer those of you looking for a B&B experience. Hosts David and Karen provide the real deal in hospitality and comfort with every request and requirement catered for. The accommodation is delightful and together with a delicious breakfast, including the best Grenola this side of anywhere, you'll be going back time after time. Room 6 has a fantastic view of Skiddaw and is a firm recommendation, but unless you book it you'll never know! Fantastic time, Many thanks David and of course Chef too!
reviews.title: A Jewel in the Keswick Crown
Superb Guesthouse
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Oakthwaite for just one night at the end of March on the strength of the recommendations found on this site. We were delighted when we saw our room - the super king size - this place is a real gem.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are spotlessly clean and are decorated to a high standard with modern furnishings. Lots of extra touches (chocolates, CD player, DVD player) made the stay really special. The breakfast was superb and the hosts are very friendly and helpful. We wil definitely be returning for a longer stay!
reviews.title: A welcoming and refreshing house!

likes.liked: — The owners warm and friendly attitude and the cleanliness and class of the decor

reviews.title: Excellent!
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this B&B again this year, a year on from last year and this being my first review for this guest house, thought it was well deserverd, albeit a month on.
The owners, David and Karen made us both feel very welcome again. The guest house is easy to fing with lovely walks both easy and strenuous, a footprint away from the front door.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a fantastic weekend break at Oakthwaite. David & Karen were both extremely friendly and knowledgeable about walks of all levels of ability. The walk from the B&B to Walla Crag took about an hour and was well worth the climb as the views were spectacular. Our room, the king size, was excellent with a good view of Walla Crag. The extra touches (chocolates, nice toiletries & DVDs) made it seem more like a hotel than a B&B. And the breakfasts were outstanding, the granola and pancakes especially. We will go back!
reviews.title: The perfect B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading the great reviews on Trip Advisor, my husband and I felt confident we were making the right choice when we made our reservation. We were not disappointed. We received a warm welcome from Karen Faria who runs the B&B with her husband David.
reviews.title: Perfect

likes.liked: — We liked everything, lovely hosts, very clean, comfy bed and pillows. Perfect

reviews.text: Karen showed us to our room, which was beautifully decorated. The bed was immaculately dressed with lovely crisp white linen, and plenty of big comfy pillows. There were nice little touches, such as a complimentary boxed chocolate and a little bag filled with lovely toiletries as well as a large bottle of drinking water. The room and en-suite were immaculate as was the rest of the Guest House. Our room also had a TV with DVD player along with music CD's to listen and relax to. There was a good selection of DVD's available to the guest.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast came in two sizes! Depending on the size of your appetite there was a choice of small or large porridge/granola (both of which were wonderful) followed a hearty English Beakfast, or poached egg on toast and a few other choices which unfortunately I can't remember! Anyway it was all good :] My husband said it was the best English Breakfast he has ever eaten.
reviews.title: A serene experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The accommodation is very close to the town centre of Keswick, approximately 10 mins through residential streets.
reviews.title: Wonderful Guest House

description: Oakthwaite House is a Victorian town house built c.1876 in a quiet residential area of Keswick, only a five-minute walk from the town centre. We provide a high quality service and offer you a comfortable, relaxing, refreshing and enjoyable stay. The location of our guesthouse in Keswick and in the Lake District National Park makes it an ideal base from which to explore and enjoy the many wonders of the northern Lakes.
